article.headline: Sacred Heart 61, Holy Cross 58
article.story: FAIRFIELD, Conn. (AP) -- Drew Shubik hit a 15-footer with 21 seconds left to secure Sacred Heart's 61-58 win over Holy Cross on Sunday. Crusaders' Colin Cunningham scored on a baseline drive to make it 59-58 with 1:27 left, leaving the Pioneers clinging to a one-point lead. Sacred Heart's Chauncey Hardy tapped his missed shot out to Shubik, who ran down the 35-second shot clock before hitting a pull-up jumper for the final points of the game. The Pioneers' Ryon Howard deflected a 3-pointer by the Adam May of Holy Cross just before the final buzzer to preserve the victory. Luke Granato, who hit 6-of-10 3-pointers, led Sacred Heart (5-8) with a season-high 18 points. Shubik had 11 points and Hardy and Ryan Litke 10 each for the Pioneers, who have won five of their last seven games after an 0-6 start. Center Tim Clifford topped Holy Cross (7-3) with 24 points and seven rebounds. Cunningham had 10 points as the Crusaders, who led by as much as six in the second half, suffered their second straight loss. Sacred Heart opened its biggest lead on a 3-pointer by Granato that gave the Pioneers a 22-13 edge, but the Crusaders used a 16-6 run to move in front 29-28 at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
